intro: Schkuhria wislizeni var. frustrata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved yarrow, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like foliage and small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are linear and often have a slightly hairy texture, while the flowers are arranged in dense, flat-topped clusters. This variety is distinguished by its reduced leaf size compared to the typical form of Schkuhria wislizeni.
